SENT.plain: A patient with severe post-hepatitis B aplastic anemia had depressed B and T cell responses
In mixed leukocyte culture, her cell were unresponsive to unrelated control stimulating cells, but responded well to a pool of cells from the same unrelated controls
She had reduced production of lymphocyte mitogenic factor (MF), suggesting a helper cell defect, and she had few or no cells reactive with the monoclonal anti-T cell antibodies OKT3, OKT4 or OKT5
Her cells proliferated in response to MF produced by a pool of cells without mitogen, however
Furthermore, her cells became specifically cytotoxic when stimulated by cells plus MF, but not when stimulated by either cells or MF alone
Thus her T cell deficiency was correctable by nonspecific helper factor in vitro
